page.title: 12ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: The place of the {Public House}in the country is paramount. They are places for meeting friends, gossip, good conversation and playing games,not to mention the beer and cider. The area has five pubs, all excellent and two hotel bars.The three most popular games played in pubs are cribbage, dominoes and darts. In the Wintertime these games are played between pubs as is the Quiz game. Tippit, Quoits, Table Skittles, Shove-halfpenny and Draughts are some of the older games which are not so often played now. The pub is also a clearing house for local news and rumour, it is a centre for charities and the public houses of Campden have raised large amounts of money to help good causes. Three of the area pulic houses are owned by the brewery and two are privately owned or "free houses".
